body:
### Problem

Problem: Downloading the latest aarch64-linux nightly release provides a 32-bit ELF rather than a 64-elf. 

Further Description:
Downloading 'nvim-linux-arm64.appimage' from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/nightly/nvim-linux-arm64.appimage
with sha256sum: `88d0cfc42dafade14e12cb4fdc9e760b7b76fd01a78ef0e78cec8d6580e98df4`

Running `file nvim-linux-arm64.appimage`
produces `nvim-linux-arm64.appimage: ELF 32-bit LSB pie executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), static-pie linked, BuildID[sha1]=1a9abc749122c8bb76290e5e39fb5f1a3014458b, stripped`

This produces an: `exec format error: ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage`
when attempting to run.

Previous versions downloaded in the last week have worked correctly, one example of file:
ELF 64-bit LSB pie executable, ARM aarch64, version 1 (SYSV), static-pie linked, BuildID[sha1]=8b1028122120dc38a9b51955cb51306a870c2b5f, stripped
This version is: `NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1537+g6dd6c5b523` which was correctly serving 64-bit!

### Steps to reproduce

`wget https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/nightly/nvim-linux-arm64.appimage`
`file nvim-linux-arm64.appimage`
`chmod u+x nvim-linux-arm64.appimage`
`./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage`

### Expected behavior

File should be a 64-bit elf, but instead is 32-bit elf.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

b92b95e2c26d5cea86acd3116ee029cc57676f14

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Fedora release 42 (Adams) (arm64)

### Terminal name/version

N/A

### $TERM environment variable

N/A

### Installation

appimage

labels.name: build

labels.description: wrong behavior that was introduced in a previous commit (please bisect)
labels.name: bug-regression

title: Nightly build appimage serves 32 bit elf instead of 64 bit.
